Annotation.note:
Let three triangles $ABC$, $DEF$, $GHI$ be given such that lines $AB$, $DE$, $GH$ intersect in a point $P$, lines $AC$, $DF$, $GI$ intersect in a point $Q$, lines $BC$, $EF$, $HI$ intersect in a point $R$, and $P, Q, R$ are collinear. In view of Desargues' theorem, the lines in each of the triads $AD, BE, CF; AG, BH, CI; DG, EH, FI$ intersect in a point. Prove that these three points are collinear.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
